problem:
What characteristics of arthropods have been of primary importance in their evolutionary success?

A. Development of a chitinous exoskeleton, well-developed organ systems and complex organization of the nervous tissues.

B. Adoption of aquatic respiration across all species

C. Development of a large number of non-specialized appendages

D. Simple organ systems

E. Evolution of a single pair of wings for flight

F. Development of a soft exoskeleton

G. Limited nervous tissues

H. Reduction in body segmentation for increased mobility

I. Presence of a single, central eye for improved vision

J. Development of a porous exoskeleton for better gas exchange
